DOC.brief_summary: Comparison of functional outcome at 3 years after trapezio-metacarpal arthroplasty with trapeziectomy and trapeziectomy with ligament reconstruction and tendon interposition.
DOC.brief_title: Comparison of ARPE Prosthesis With the Literature
DOC.detailed_description: The primary objective is to compare functional outcome at 3 years after trapezio-metarcarpal arthroplasty with trapeziectomy and trapeziectomy with ligament reconstruction and tendon interposition. Literature values obtained by a recently published meta analysis1 will be used. Secondary objectives are: - to compare functional outcome at 1 and at 5 years after trapezio-metarcarpal arthroplasty with trapeziectomy and trapeziectomy with ligament reconstruction and tendon interposition - to determine pre- and postop HR QOL - Incidence of RLL at each follow up time point. Literature values from the same meta analysis1 will be used.
DOC.criteria: patients with trapeziometacarpal arthritis Eaton Stage of trapeziometacarpal arthritis : Stage II IV willing to return for follow up evaluation. local or systemic infections severe muscular, neurological or vascular deficiencies of the extremity involved bone destruction or poor bone to affect implant stability allergy to any of the components of the implant
